fields.description: The cost price for the retailer. The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
CostPrice

fields.description: The regular price from the planned price list that is valid for any customer under these sales conditions (i.e. before applying price selection rules or discounts). E.g. in IPOS this can be Regular Price or Regular Eat-In Price (either restaurant or bistro). The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales. This price does not exist in case the selling system has no record of a regular price for this item. This is e.g. the case when SAMS provides a price for an item (=QualifiedPrice), while for the selling system (IPOS) this item is unknown.
Example of regular price sources: RegularSalesUnitPrice, Ukulele:RegularEatInPrice, Ukulele:RegularBistroPrice, Ukulele:RegularBistroEatInPrice
fields.name: PriceSource

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
RegularPrice

fields.description: This price is the price that the specific customer qualified for. The price is coming from different price lists, bargain prices, SAMS return (might be lowered), iSell order (might be partial payment) or manually agreed prices with the cashier. After the qualified price has been settled, other campaigns and discounts are applied on top of this. The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.

Examples of qualified price sources: - When from a price list: Ukulele:FamilyPrice, Ukulele:FamilyEatInPrice, Ukulele:CoWorkerPrice, Ukulele:CoWorkerEatInPrice, Ukulele:ContractorPrice, Ukulele:ContractorEatInPrice - Bargain items with special price (usually from barcode): IposAsIs - Manual price set by cashier during sale/return: IposManual - Original price provided by SAMS during return: SamsOriginal - Manual price set by customer relations during return: SamsManual - The price to pay for the item according to iSell (possibly partial payment): IsellToPay
fields.name: PriceSource

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
QualifiedPrice

fields.description: Components of financial interest that are part of the price or that needs to be added to the price. The sign of these price components does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
The context of the price component. E.g. Fee, Deposit,
fields.name: Context

fields.description: The trigger of including the price component. E.g. RecyclingFee, BottleDeposit, MattressFee, EnvironmentalFee
fields.name: Trigger

fields.description: How the price component is to be or is included: E.g. IncludedInNetPrice, IncludedInGrossPrice, AddedToNetPrice, AddedToGrossPrice
fields.name: Inclusion
ExternalPriceComponentList

fields.description: This is the actual unit price, after a possible qualified price has been selected and all discounts have been applied. It might also be a calculated net price, in case the planned price was including tax but the country default setting is to not include tax in the price (e.g. in US bistro) The price must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. Note that this amount is not always the same as QualifiedUnitPrice - TotalUnitDiscount, since some qualified unit prices are themselves considered discounts (e.g. family prices). The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.

fields.description: These dates are used by the tax calculation engine to determine if tax point has been reached or not. If TaxPointDate is not set, then tax point is not yet reached for this line. The Tax Point is the point in time which determines in which Tax Period the Tax becomes due. The Tax Point is normally also the valid date for determining the Tax Base, applicable Tax Rate, etc. Subsequently, the Tax Point also refers to the point in time when the Ukulele Group Company needs to report the Indirect Tax due on a sales transaction in the Tax Return. A Tax Point can occur on different moments in time, depending on the country specific rules and particular situation. On a global level we have the following dates that can be a Tax Point. - Date of delivery of goods - Date of service completion - Date of (pre-)payment - Invoice date - Date of dispatch (of goods, e.g. in RU, IN). Details for when Invoice date is Tax Point: In tax jurisdictions where the invoice date can be a Tax Point, we also need to consider the Tax Invoicing
Filled with the date from above list that defines the taxpoint. This will be empty as long as tax point is not reached.
fields.name: TaxPointDate

OriginalDetails

fields.description: The list of duplicates that exist for this original. The difference between copy and duplicate is that the duplicate is created at the exact same time as the original, containing the exact same information (except header and possibly digital signature). The copy on the other hand is a copy of an original or duplicate, created at a later time than the original/duplicate, containing the exact same information as the original/duplicate (except header only). Reprint is another printout of what was printed or a file copy of a PDF, which does not count as a new legal document, i.e. it is exactly the same information including headers. Reprints are not captured in this model.
An external id identifying this duplicate within the transaction.
fields.name: Id

fields.description: E.g. Duplicate for Transporter, Duplicate for Supplier, Triplicate for Supplier
fields.name: Name

fields.description: Currently supported values: Duplicate - The second identical copy of the original Triplicate - The third identical copy of the original These documents might each have different signatures compared to the original.
fields.name: Type

fields.description: A reference to the signature that was used for this duplicate.
fields.name: SignatureIdReference
DuplicateList

fields.description: This is the type of copy. Supported values are: CopyOfOriginal - This is a copy of the original document. CopyOfDuplicate - This is a copy of a duplicate document (i.e. from the duplicate list of the original). The DocumentDuplicateReference indicates which of the duplicates that was copied. For the difference between copy and duplicate, see DocumentDuplicateList.
fields.name: Type

fields.description: If the DocumentCopyType=CopyOfDuplicate, then this references (using the duplicate id) which duplicate of the original that was copied.
fields.name: DuplicateIdReference

fields.description: The list of tax decisions taken by the tax calculation engine for this transaction. Multiple Tax Decision Sets (TDS) can only occur if the transaction is combined from different item classifications, like materials and services or e.g. by the combination of multiple transports into one invoice. Currently in TIM, each line is assigned to only one TDS. The grouping criterion for retail processing is TIC value of the line. So, each line with a certain TIC will be assigned to a group (=TDS) representing the TIC. After the tax determination (= determining the TDS fields seller country/state, seller tax reg country/state and tax indicator) the existing TDSs will be merged to one TDS again if the TDS fields are identical. This is currently the case in all existing retail scenarios.
The tax indicator is a string that describes the flow of goods and services from tax point of view.
Short name of the tax indicator. Example: MAT_FST (CA)

fields.description: These dates are used by the tax calculation engine to determine if tax point has been reached or not. If TaxPointDate is not set, then tax point is not yet reached for this line. The Tax Point is the point in time which determines in which Tax Period the Tax becomes due. The Tax Point is normally also the valid date for determining the Tax Base, applicable Tax Rate, etc. Subsequently, the Tax Point also refers to the point in time when the Ukulele Group Company needs to report the Indirect Tax due on a sales transaction in the Tax Return. A Tax Point can occur on different moments in time, depending on the country specific rules and particular situation. On a global level we have the following dates that can be a Tax Point. - Date of delivery of goods - Date of service completion - Date of (pre-)payment - Invoice date - Date of dispatch (of goods, e.g. in RU, IN). Details for when Invoice date is Tax Point: In tax jurisdictions where the invoice date can be a Tax Point, we also need to consider the Tax Invoicing
Filled with the date from above list that defines the taxpoint. This will be empty as long as tax point is not reached.
fields.name: TaxPointDate

The date/time when this Customer Transaction was recorded by the system.
fields.name: SystemImportDateTime

fields.description: The date/time when the evaluation of this Customer Transaction was completed for the first time, i.e. when the raw input imported at SystemImportDateTime was successfully transformed into an internal CT-event and made available for reports and consumer queries. The transaction could e.g. get stuck for some time in the evaluation due to some defect or similar issue.
fields.name: FirstEvaluationDateTime

fields.description: The date/time when the evaluation of this Customer Transaction was completed, i.e. the last time the raw input imported at SystemImportDateTime was successfully transformed into an internal CT-event and made available for reports and consumer queries. This date/time differs from FirstEvaluationDateTime as soon as the raw transaction is reprocessed for some reason.
fields.name: LastEvaluationDateTime

fields.description: The last validation status after evaluating the raw input data and transforming it into the internal CT-event. E.g. OK, INCOMPLETE, INVALID.

fields.description: The ID of the specific validation message. E.g. CTEvent.LineItemList.LineItem.Description_MaxLength

fields.description: The version of the recorded customer transaction, starting with 1. This is greater than 1 in case a source system delivers an updated raw payload of an already existing customer transaction. E.g. if IPOS prints tax data on the document, but it is missing in the transaction because of a system defect, and then later resends an updated version of the transaction data.

fields.description: The version of the format within the source system. E.g. for iSell it can be 2.0, 2.1, etc. For iPOS it can be the version of the TP.net transaction XSD.

fields.description: The event type on a high level. Supported values are: - RetailTx - DocumentTx - SalesCompletionTx These event types are not disjunct, instead they can include eachother, e.g. a RetailTx can also implicitly be a DocumentTx and a SalesCompletionTx. Examples: - A recorded IPOS transaction from a store with at least one cash and carry sale is primarily a PaymentTx, but also a DocumentTx (the receipt) and a SalesCompletionTx (the cash and carry line items). - A recorded SAMS transform of a receipt into an invoice is a pure DocumentTx. - A recorded iSell delivery-signal is a pure SalesCompletionTx. - A recorded invoice that was triggered by an iSell delivery-signal is a DocumentTx, but also a SalesCompletionTx.

Reference to another document that is usually printed on the document. The same reference might also be found in the transaction trail. Examples: - reference on a credit note to the original invoice number. - reference to the document that was replaced by the current document from a financial perspective. - reference to the original from the copy This latter is the case for invoice transforms (e.g. from ReceiptProof to Invoice or from offline to online invoice). NOTE: When making a full credit note of an Invoice, this does not replace the original document from a financial perspective, i.e. both documents are still valid and must be considered when analysing the transaction trail.
This can be used in combination with DocumentIdReference in order to secure that the reference in unambiguous. E.g. when SAMS reference the receipt for which the return transaction is valid.

fields.description: The list of duplicates that exist for this original. The difference between copy and duplicate is that the duplicate is created at the exact same time as the original, containing the exact same information (except header and possibly digital signature). The copy on the other hand is a copy of an original or duplicate, created at a later time than the original/duplicate, containing the exact same information as the original/duplicate (except header only). Reprint is another printout of what was printed or a file copy of a PDF, which does not count as a new legal document, i.e. it is exactly the same information including headers. Reprints are not captured in this model.

fields.description: Item Quantity, Positive value if item sales (or cancellation of return). Negative value if item return (or cancellation of sale). Might be a decimal value for measured items (e.g. Fabric, candy). When QuantityUoMCode=EA, then it is always an integer.
fields.name: Quantity

fields.description: Standard used: UN/ECE REC 20 Supported values: EA (each), LTR (litre), INH (inch), MMT (millimetre), MTR (metre), GRM (gram), KGM (kilogram), CMQ (centimeter) If unit of measurement is not known (e.g. return of unknown article), then the value UNKNOWN is used.
fields.name: QuantityUoMCode

fields.description: The translated unit of the measure, e.g. pieces, meter, grams.
fields.name: QuantityUoMText

fields.description: The code for the currency (ISO standard 4217) of all prices/amounts of this line item.
fields.name: CurrencyCode

fields.description: All different prices for one single unit of this item is in here. The sign of any of these prices does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
The cost price for the retailer. The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
CostPrice

fields.description: The regular price from the planned price list that is valid for any customer under these sales conditions (i.e. before applying price selection rules or discounts). E.g. in IPOS this can be Regular Price or Regular Eat-In Price (either restaurant or bistro). The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales. This price does not exist in case the selling system has no record of a regular price for this item. This is e.g. the case when SAMS provides a price for an item (=QualifiedPrice), while for the selling system (IPOS) this item is unknown.
Example of regular price sources: RegularSalesUnitPrice, Ukulele:RegularEatInPrice, Ukulele:RegularBistroPrice, Ukulele:RegularBistroEatInPrice
fields.name: PriceSource

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
RegularPrice

fields.description: This price is the price that the specific customer qualified for. The price is coming from different price lists, bargain prices, SAMS return (might be lowered), iSell order (might be partial payment) or manually agreed prices with the cashier. After the qualified price has been settled, other campaigns and discounts are applied on top of this. The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.

Examples of qualified price sources: - When from a price list: Ukulele:FamilyPrice, Ukulele:FamilyEatInPrice, Ukulele:CoWorkerPrice, Ukulele:CoWorkerEatInPrice, Ukulele:ContractorPrice, Ukulele:ContractorEatInPrice - Bargain items with special price (usually from barcode): IposAsIs - Manual price set by cashier during sale/return: IposManual - Original price provided by SAMS during return: SamsOriginal - Manual price set by customer relations during return: SamsManual - The price to pay for the item according to iSell (possibly partial payment): IsellToPay
fields.name: PriceSource

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
QualifiedPrice

fields.description: Components of financial interest that are part of the price or that needs to be added to the price. The sign of these price components does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
The context of the price component. E.g. Fee, Deposit,
fields.name: Context

fields.description: The trigger of including the price component. E.g. RecyclingFee, BottleDeposit, MattressFee, EnvironmentalFee
fields.name: Trigger

fields.description: How the price component is to be or is included: E.g. IncludedInNetPrice, IncludedInGrossPrice, AddedToNetPrice, AddedToGrossPrice
fields.name: Inclusion
ExternalPriceComponentList

fields.description: This is the actual unit price, after a possible qualified price has been selected and all discounts have been applied. It might also be a calculated net price, in case the planned price was including tax but the country default setting is to not include tax in the price (e.g. in US bistro) The price must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. Note that this amount is not always the same as QualifiedUnitPrice - TotalUnitDiscount, since some qualified unit prices are themselves considered discounts (e.g. family prices). The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
ActualUnitPrice

fields.description: The extended price is the UnitPrice*Quantity before any discount has been applied
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
ExtendedPrice
PriceDetails

fields.description: All different discounts for this line item is in here, both single unit and line item totals. The sign of single unit discounts is always negative and does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales. The sign of line item total discounts changes depending on the sign of the quantity, i.e. it is positive in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales (since unit discount is negative).
List of discounts applied on this line item Note: The discount list does not always include discount given as part of a qualified price, e.g. a co-worker food price.
Details of applied discount
Description of applied discount
fields.name: Description

fields.description: Discount amount, i.e. how much is the price lowered per unit. This unit discount amount is always negative. It must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. The sign of this unit amount does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
fields.name: UnitAmount

fields.description: Discount type on item level.
fields.name: Type

fields.description: The source system from where the discount originates.
fields.name: Source

fields.description: An identifier that is unique for the discount within the source system.
fields.name: Code

fields.description: Discount reference, e.g. number of voucher card used to get the discount or the family card number. If a transaction is qualified for family discount but the family card number is missing (e.g. for a return), then the discount Reference element is empty or does not exist.
fields.name: Reference

fields.description: The amount that was the base for the discount amount calculation (the amount before the discount was deducted)
fields.name: LineTotalDiscountableAmount

fields.description: TotalDiscount = UnitDiscount * Quantity It must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. The sign of this total amount changes in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales, since then the quantity is negative.
fields.name: TotalAmount

fields.description: E.g. AppliedOnNet, AppliedOnGross
fields.name: ApplyMethod
Discount
DiscountList

fields.description: The total direct discount given for one single item of the current line. This unit discount total amount is always negative. fields.name: DirectTotalUnitAmount

fields.description: The total direct discount given for all items of the current line. It must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. The sign of this total amount changes in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales, since then the quantity is negative.
fields.name: DirectTotalAmount
DiscountDetails

fields.description: Amount = ActualUnitPrice x Quantity It must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. The sign of this total amount changes in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales, since then the quantity is negative.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
ExtendedAmount

fields.description: The partial extended amount paid/refunded for this line item. This amount is specified when only parts of this line item was paid/refunded. Example: If an iSell order has partial payment, then IPOS will only get the part that is to be paid for each item. - If tax point is at delivery for an partially paid iSell order (e.g. using VISA card), then the tax invoice generated at delivery will have the full amounts. - the remaining payment might arrive later from RIMS or some third party (e.g. the delivery firm that completed the delivery) The sign of this amount changes in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales, since this is related to the payment/refund.
fields.name: PartialAmount

fields.description: List of transaction/document references using a transaction/document identifier.

Reference to another document that is usually printed on the document. The same reference might also be found in the transaction trail. Examples: - reference on a credit note to the original invoice number. - reference to the document that was replaced by the current document from a financial perspective. - reference to the original from the copy This latter is the case for invoice transforms (e.g. from ReceiptProof to Invoice or from offline to online invoice). NOTE: When making a full credit note of an Invoice, this does not replace the original document from a financial perspective, i.e. both documents are still valid and must be considered when analysing the transaction trail.
This can be used in combination with DocumentIdReference in order to secure that the reference in unambiguous. E.g. when SAMS reference the receipt for which the return transaction is valid.

CostPrice

fields.description: The regular price from the planned price list that is valid for any customer under these sales conditions (i.e. before applying price selection rules or discounts). E.g. in IPOS this can be Regular Price or Regular Eat-In Price (either restaurant or bistro). The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales. This price does not exist in case the selling system has no record of a regular price for this item. This is e.g. the case when SAMS provides a price for an item (=QualifiedPrice), while for the selling system (IPOS) this item is unknown.
Example of regular price sources: RegularSalesUnitPrice, Ukulele:RegularEatInPrice, Ukulele:RegularBistroPrice, Ukulele:RegularBistroEatInPrice
fields.name: PriceSource

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
RegularPrice

fields.description: This price is the price that the specific customer qualified for. The price is coming from different price lists, bargain prices, SAMS return (might be lowered), iSell order (might be partial payment) or manually agreed prices with the cashier. After the qualified price has been settled, other campaigns and discounts are applied on top of this. The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.

Examples of qualified price sources: - When from a price list: Ukulele:FamilyPrice, Ukulele:FamilyEatInPrice, Ukulele:CoWorkerPrice, Ukulele:CoWorkerEatInPrice, Ukulele:ContractorPrice, Ukulele:ContractorEatInPrice - Bargain items with special price (usually from barcode): IposAsIs - Manual price set by cashier during sale/return: IposManual - Original price provided by SAMS during return: SamsOriginal - Manual price set by customer relations during return: SamsManual - The price to pay for the item according to iSell (possibly partial payment): IsellToPay
fields.name: PriceSource

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
QualifiedPrice

fields.description: Components of financial interest that are part of the price or that needs to be added to the price. The sign of these price components does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
The context of the price component. E.g. Fee, Deposit,
fields.name: Context

fields.description: The trigger of including the price component. E.g. RecyclingFee, BottleDeposit, MattressFee, EnvironmentalFee

fields.description: This is the actual unit price, after a possible qualified price has been selected and all discounts have been applied. It might also be a calculated net price, in case the planned price was including tax but the country default setting is to not include tax in the price (e.g. in US bistro) The price must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. Note that this amount is not always the same as QualifiedUnitPrice - TotalUnitDiscount, since some qualified unit prices are themselves considered discounts (e.g. family prices). The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.

fields.description: The partial extended amount paid/refunded for this line item. This amount is specified when only parts of this line item was paid/refunded. fields.description: List of transaction/document references using a transaction/document identifier.

Reference to another document that is usually printed on the document. The same reference might also be found in the transaction trail. Examples: - reference on a credit note to the original invoice number. - reference to the document that was replaced by the current document from a financial perspective. - reference to the original from the copy This latter is the case for invoice transforms (e.g. from ReceiptProof to Invoice or from offline to online invoice). NOTE: When making a full credit note of an Invoice, this does not replace the original document from a financial perspective, i.e. both documents are still valid and must be considered when analysing the transaction trail.
This can be used in combination with DocumentIdReference in order to secure that the reference in unambiguous. E.g. when SAMS reference the receipt for which the return transaction is valid.

fields.description: Structure Line Name is naming the level in the line structure hierarchy (see examples below). Leaf: - LineItem (only ref to line item) Parents: - Product (e.g. SPR) - TextLine (the text as printed on the RetailProof/Invoice) - Group (e.g. SGR) - Invoice (e.g. multiple invoices in IN) - InvoicePage (e.g. in CN) - Service (e.g. the goods onto which a Delivery/Assembly service is applied) - Deposit (e.g. a drink item references the bottle deposit child item)

fields.description: On a specific level in the line structure hierarchy, this holds external attributes

Country/store dependent external attributes relevant for the document structure. Examples per StructureLineName: LineItem - No external fields here, they are in the external field list of the line item itself, if any. Product - ItemNo, ItemType Invoice - InvoiceNo, InvoiceFormat (e.g. BillOfSupply in IN), TaxRegisterNumber, CashierName, InvoiceCode (parent invoice number in CN), TotalPages InvoicePage - CurrentPage, InvoiceNo (each page has different invoice number in CN), PageText (translated text to print on the invoice page in CN) Service - Which line items onto which the service is applied. Deposit - Which non-Ukulele mandatory line item that was sold together with a line item.

fields.description: The list of tax decisions taken by the tax calculation engine for this transaction. Multiple Tax Decision Sets (TDS) can only occur if the transaction is combined from different item classifications, like materials and services or e.g. by the combination of multiple transports into one invoice. Currently in TIM, each line is assigned to only one TDS. The grouping criterion for retail processing is TIC value of the line. So, each line with a certain TIC will be assigned to a group (=TDS) representing the TIC. After the tax determination (= determining the TDS fields seller country/state, seller tax reg country/state and tax indicator) the existing TDSs will be merged to one TDS again if the TDS fields are identical. This is currently the case in all existing retail scenarios.
The tax indicator is a string that describes the flow of goods and services from tax point of view.
Short name of the tax indicator. Example: MAT_FST (CA)
fields.name: TaxIndicatorAbbreviation

fields.description: Long name of the tax indicator. Example: Domestic Federal and State Tax (CA)
fields.name: TaxIndicatorName

fields.description: Legal text that has to be printed on the invoice for this type of invoice. Example: GST and State Tax transaction (CA)

fields.description: These dates are used by the tax calculation engine to determine if tax point has been reached or not. If TaxPointDate is not set, then tax point is not yet reached for this line. The Tax Point is the point in time which determines in which Tax Period the Tax becomes due. The Tax Point is normally also the valid date for determining the Tax Base, applicable Tax Rate, etc. Subsequently, the Tax Point also refers to the point in time when the Ukulele Group Company needs to report the Indirect Tax due on a sales transaction in the Tax Return. A Tax Point can occur on different moments in time, depending on the country specific rules and particular situation. On a global level we have the following dates that can be a Tax Point. - Date of delivery of goods - Date of service completion - Date of (pre-)payment - Invoice date - Date of dispatch (of goods, e.g. in RU, IN). Details for when Invoice date is Tax Point: In tax jurisdictions where the invoice date can be a Tax Point, we also need to consider the Tax Invoicing
Filled with the date from above list that defines the taxpoint. This will be empty as long as tax point is not reached.

E.g. if IPOS prints tax data on the document, but it is missing in the transaction because of a system defect, and then later resends an updated version of the transaction data.
fields.name: TransactionVersion

fields.description: The version of the format within the source system. E.g. for iSell it can be 2.0, 2.1, etc. For iPOS it can be the version of the TP.net transaction XSD.
fields.name: SourceFormatVersion

fields.description: The ID and version of the source system creating the payload. E.g. for iPOS it could be iPOS_7.8.0.13. For iSell it could be the Tax Invoice EBC version: iSellInvoice_1.1
fields.name: SourceSystemVersion

fields.description: This is the ID and version of a system that will strongly affect the content within the payload. E.g. the iSell EBC version: iSell_7.9
fields.name: SourceDependentSystemVersion

fields.description: The version of the internal CT-event XSD used to represent this transaction. E.g. 2.0.9
fields.name: InternalFormatVersion

fields.description: The ID and version of the mapping requirement document used to create this internal CT-event. E.g. iPOS_1.0.2 or iSell_1.0.0
fields.name: EvaluationMappingVersion

fields.description: The internal code version that evaluated and mapped the raw data into the internal CT-event. Typically a composition of code module name and version. E.g. iposTxEvaluation_1.3.5.4
fields.name: EvaluationCodeVersion

fields.description: Globally unique identifier of the transaction. In order to be able to guarantee uniqueness, this ID must be generated within the system. It might e.g. be used by SAMS to unambiguously point out which transaction that was used for a customer return of goods.
fields.name: Id

fields.description: The date/time when the recorded Customer Transaction event happened in the real world. E.g. the end date/time of a cash and carry sales transaction paid with cash or when delivered goods were handed over to the customer. NOTE: This date/time might not be the same as when the document was issued (see Document/IssueDate for details).
fields.name: EventDateTime

fields.description: The date and time when this transaction started to be created by the source system
fields.name: TransactionStartDateTime

fields.description: The date/time when the recorded document was completed by the source system
fields.name: TransactionEndDateTime

fields.description: The event type on a high level. Supported values are: - RetailTx - DocumentTx - SalesCompletionTx These event types are not disjunct, instead they can include eachother, e.g. a RetailTx can also implicitly be a DocumentTx and a SalesCompletionTx. Examples: - A recorded IPOS transaction from a store with at least one cash and carry sale is primarily a PaymentTx, but also a DocumentTx (the receipt) and a SalesCompletionTx (the cash and carry line items). - A recorded SAMS transform of a receipt into an invoice is a pure DocumentTx. - A recorded iSell delivery-signal is a pure SalesCompletionTx. - A recorded invoice that was triggered by an iSell delivery-signal is a DocumentTx, but also a SalesCompletionTx.
fields.name: EventType

fields.description: If the customer transaction qualifies as a B2B transaction or is considered to be an interaction with a private customer. Supported values are: B2B B2C
fields.name: BusinessType

fields.description: List of transaction/document references using a transaction/document identifier.

Reference to another document that is usually printed on the document. The same reference might also be found in the transaction trail. Examples: - reference on a credit note to the original invoice number. - reference to the document that was replaced by the current document from a financial perspective. - reference to the original from the copy This latter is the case for invoice transforms (e.g. from ReceiptProof to Invoice or from offline to online invoice). NOTE: When making a full credit note of an Invoice, this does not replace the original document from a financial perspective, i.e. both documents are still valid and must be considered when analysing the transaction trail.
This can be used in combination with DocumentIdReference in order to secure that the reference in unambiguous. E.g. when SAMS reference the receipt for which the return transaction is valid.

fields.description: Structure Line Name is naming the level in the line structure hierarchy (see examples below). Leaf: - LineItem (only ref to line item) Parents: - Product (e.g. SPR) - TextLine (the text as printed on the RetailProof/Invoice) - Group (e.g. SGR) - Invoice (e.g. multiple invoices in IN) - InvoicePage (e.g. in CN) - Service (e.g. the goods onto which a Delivery/Assembly service is applied) - Deposit (e.g. a drink item references the bottle deposit child item)

fields.description: On a specific level in the line structure hierarchy, this holds external attributes

Country/store dependent external attributes relevant for the document structure. Examples per StructureLineName: LineItem - No external fields here, they are in the external field list of the line item itself, if any. Product - ItemNo, ItemType Invoice - InvoiceNo, InvoiceFormat (e.g. BillOfSupply in IN), TaxRegisterNumber, CashierName, InvoiceCode (parent invoice number in CN), TotalPages InvoicePage - CurrentPage, InvoiceNo (each page has different invoice number in CN), PageText (translated text to print on the invoice page in CN) Service - Which line items onto which the service is applied. Deposit - Which non-Ukulele mandatory line item that was sold together with a line item.

fields.description: The amount rounded by the retail system in order to reach the smallest denomination. E.g. when paying with cash rounding is done to the smallest denomination in that country. The sign of the rounding difference is showing how to adjust the amount that was actually paid/refunded, in order to get the PaymentDetails/TotalAmount of the current transaction. E.g. a negative CurrencyRoundingAmount for a sale means that the customer paid this amount more than the amount to pay (= TotalAmount - AmountPaid). In some countries (e.g. CN), the currency rounding is also a separate tender.

fields.description: These dates are used by the tax calculation engine to determine if tax point has been reached or not. If TaxPointDate is not set, then tax point is not yet reached for this line. The Tax Point is the point in time which determines in which Tax Period the Tax becomes due. The Tax Point is normally also the valid date for determining the Tax Base, applicable Tax Rate, etc. Subsequently, the Tax Point also refers to the point in time when the Ukulele Group Company needs to report the Indirect Tax due on a sales transaction in the Tax Return. A Tax Point can occur on different moments in time, depending on the country specific rules and particular situation. On a global level we have the following dates that can be a Tax Point. - Date of delivery of goods - Date of service completion - Date of (pre-)payment - Invoice date - Date of dispatch (of goods, e.g. in RU, IN). Details for when Invoice date is Tax Point: In tax jurisdictions where the invoice date can be a Tax Point, we also need to consider the Tax Invoicing
Filled with the date from above list that defines the taxpoint. This will be empty as long as tax point is not reached.

fields.description: The sign of these unit amounts are always positive, i.e. they do not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales, since they are not dependent on the quantity (which might be negative).

fields.description: Part of the UnitSalesPrice that is not base for taxation, considering the rules of this Tax Jurisdiction. E.g. 0.00

fields.description: Part of the UnitSalesPrice that is tax exempt, considering the rules of this Tax Jurisdiction.
fields.name: ExemptAmount

fields.description: Item tax amount - monetary value of tax for the item, considering the rules of this Tax Jurisdiction. E.g. 1.95
fields.name: TaxAmount

fields.description: Monetary value of tax in local currency for the item tax amount, considering the rules of this Tax Jurisdiction. - this is given when the currency is different from the local currency of the seller.
fields.name: LocalCurrencyTaxAmount

fields.description: Item gross value (item net amount + item tax amount), considering the rules of this Tax Jurisdiction. I.e. this gross amount ONLY includes the tax amount collected by this Tax Jurisdiction. E.g. 16.94
fields.name: GrossAmount
UnitAmounts

fields.description: The sign of these total amounts changes in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales, since a negative item quantity results in a negative tax amount (reclaim).

fields.name: NonTaxableAmount

fields.description: Part of the line price (UnitSalesPrice * Quantity) that is tax exempt, considering the rules of this Tax Jurisdiction.
fields.name: ExemptAmount

fields.description: Line tax amount - monetary value of tax for the line (Unit tax amount * quantity), considering the rules of this Tax Jurisdiction.
fields.name: TaxAmount

fields.description: Monetary value of tax in local currency for the line tax amount, considering the rules of this Tax Jurisdiction. - this is given when the currency is different from the local currency of the seller.
fields.name: LocalCurrencyTaxAmount

fields.description: Line gross value line net amount + line tax amount), considering the rules of this Tax Jurisdiction. I.e. this gross amount ONLY includes the tax amount collected by this Tax Jurisdiction.
fields.name: GrossAmount
TotalAmounts

fields.description: Country/store dependent external attributes relevant for the document structure. Examples per StructureLineName: LineItem - No external fields here, they are in the external field list of the line item itself, if any. Product - ItemNo, ItemType Invoice - InvoiceNo, InvoiceFormat (e.g. BillOfSupply in IN), TaxRegisterNumber, CashierName, InvoiceCode (parent invoice number in CN), TotalPages InvoicePage - CurrentPage, InvoiceNo (each page has different invoice number in CN), PageText (translated text to print on the invoice page in CN) Service - Which line items onto which the service is applied. Deposit - Which non-Ukulele mandatory line item that was sold together with a line item.
fields.name: Name

Name of the tax type

fields.description: 'Y' if tax exempt, else 'N'

fields.description: Taxable amount, the amount that the tax amount was calculated from E.g. 409.98

fields.description: The tax amount
fields.name: TaxAmount

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded

fields.description: List unique sequential number used for the ordering of LineItems and referencing LineItems from other LineItems, possibly from other documents. Tax information is found by finding the TaxLine(s) in the TaxDecision list that have the same LineItemNo.
fields.name: LineItemNo

fields.description: Line item number that defines the order of line items in the transaction.
fields.name: LineItemOrderNo

fields.description: Number that defines the LineItemId in the corresponding Order.
fields.name: OrderLineId

fields.description: Unique identifier of the Item. Corresponds to the ItemNo of the referenced TaxDecision TaxLine(s).
fields.name: ItemNo

fields.description: The barcode that was entered in pos for this item.
fields.name: ItemInputValue

fields.description: The method for how the barcode for this item was entered in pos.
fields.name: ItemEntryMethod

fields.description: Ukulele global type of the Item, should normally be 'ART' Corresponds to the ItemType of the referenced TaxDecision TaxLine(s).
fields.name: ItemType

fields.description: Item description
fields.name: Description

fields.description: Identification number of a group of items that a specific item belongs to.
fields.name: ItemGroup

fields.description: Item Quantity, Positive value if item sales (or cancellation of return). Negative value if item return (or cancellation of sale). Might be a decimal value for measured items (e.g. Fabric, candy). When QuantityUoMCode=EA, then it is always an integer.
fields.name: Quantity

fields.description: Standard used: UN/ECE REC 20 Supported values: EA (each), LTR (litre), INH (inch), MMT (millimetre), MTR (metre), GRM (gram), KGM (kilogram), CMQ (centimeter) If unit of measurement is not known (e.g. return of unknown article), then the value UNKNOWN is used.
fields.name: QuantityUoMCode

fields.description: The translated unit of the measure, e.g. pieces, meter, grams.
fields.name: QuantityUoMText

fields.description: The code for the currency (ISO standard 4217) of all prices/amounts of this line item.
fields.name: CurrencyCode

fields.description: All different prices for one single unit of this item is in here. The sign of any of these prices does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
The cost price for the retailer. The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
CostPrice

fields.description: The regular price from the planned price list that is valid for any customer under these sales conditions (i.e. before applying price selection rules or discounts). E.g. in IPOS this can be Regular Price or Regular Eat-In Price (either restaurant or bistro). The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales. This price does not exist in case the selling system has no record of a regular price for this item. This is e.g. the case when SAMS provides a price for an item (=QualifiedPrice), while for the selling system (IPOS) this item is unknown.
Example of regular price sources: RegularSalesUnitPrice, Ukulele:RegularEatInPrice, Ukulele:RegularBistroPrice, Ukulele:RegularBistroEatInPrice
fields.name: PriceSource

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
RegularPrice

fields.description: This price is the price that the specific customer qualified for. The price is coming from different price lists, bargain prices, SAMS return (might be lowered), iSell order (might be partial payment) or manually agreed prices with the cashier. After the qualified price has been settled, other campaigns and discounts are applied on top of this. The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.

Examples of qualified price sources: - When from a price list: Ukulele:FamilyPrice, Ukulele:FamilyEatInPrice, Ukulele:CoWorkerPrice, Ukulele:CoWorkerEatInPrice, Ukulele:ContractorPrice, Ukulele:ContractorEatInPrice - Bargain items with special price (usually from barcode): IposAsIs - Manual price set by cashier during sale/return: IposManual - Original price provided by SAMS during return: SamsOriginal - Manual price set by customer relations during return: SamsManual - The price to pay for the item according to iSell (possibly partial payment): IsellToPay
fields.name: PriceSource

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
QualifiedPrice

fields.description: Components of financial interest that are part of the price or that needs to be added to the price. The sign of these price components does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
The context of the price component. E.g. Fee, Deposit,
fields.name: Context

fields.description: The trigger of including the price component. E.g. RecyclingFee, BottleDeposit, MattressFee, EnvironmentalFee
fields.name: Trigger

fields.description: How the price component is to be or is included: E.g. IncludedInNetPrice, IncludedInGrossPrice, AddedToNetPrice, AddedToGrossPrice
fields.name: Inclusion
ExternalPriceComponentList

fields.description: This is the actual unit price, after a possible qualified price has been selected and all discounts have been applied. It might also be a calculated net price, in case the planned price was including tax but the country default setting is to not include tax in the price (e.g. in US bistro) The price must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. Note that this amount is not always the same as QualifiedUnitPrice - TotalUnitDiscount, since some qualified unit prices are themselves considered discounts (e.g. family prices). The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
ActualUnitPrice

fields.description: The extended price is the UnitPrice*Quantity before any discount has been applied
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
ExtendedPrice
PriceDetails

fields.description: All different discounts for this line item is in here, both single unit and line item totals. The sign of single unit discounts is always negative and does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales. The sign of line item total discounts changes depending on the sign of the quantity, i.e. it is positive in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales (since unit discount is negative).
List of discounts applied on this line item Note: The discount list does not always include discount given as part of a qualified price, e.g. a co-worker food price.
Details of applied discount
Description of applied discount
fields.name: Description

fields.description: Discount amount, i.e. how much is the price lowered per unit. This unit discount amount is always negative. It must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. The sign of this unit amount does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
fields.name: UnitAmount

fields.description: Discount type on item level.
fields.name: Type

fields.description: The source system from where the discount originates.
fields.name: Source

fields.description: An identifier that is unique for the discount within the source system.
fields.name: Code

fields.description: Discount reference, e.g. number of voucher card used to get the discount or the family card number. If a transaction is qualified for family discount but the family card number is missing (e.g. for a return), then the discount Reference element is empty or does not exist.
fields.name: Reference

fields.description: The amount that was the base for the discount amount calculation (the amount before the discount was deducted)
fields.name: LineTotalDiscountableAmount

fields.description: TotalDiscount = UnitDiscount * Quantity It must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. The sign of this total amount changes in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales, since then the quantity is negative.
fields.name: TotalAmount

fields.description: E.g. AppliedOnNet, AppliedOnGross
fields.name: ApplyMethod
Discount
DiscountList

fields.description: The total direct discount given for one single item of the current line. This unit discount total amount is always negative. It must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. The sign of this total amount does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
fields.name: DirectTotalUnitAmount

fields.description: The total direct discount given for all items of the current line. It must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. The sign of this total amount changes in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales, since then the quantity is negative.
fields.name: DirectTotalAmount
DiscountDetails

fields.description: Amount = ActualUnitPrice x Quantity It must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. The sign of this total amount changes in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales, since then the quantity is negative.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
ExtendedAmount

fields.description: The partial extended amount paid/refunded for this line item. This amount is specified when only parts of this line item was paid/refunded. Example: If an iSell order has partial payment, then IPOS will only get the part that is to be paid for each item. - If tax point is at delivery for an partially paid iSell order (e.g. using VISA card), then the tax invoice generated at delivery will have the full amounts. - the remaining payment might arrive later from RIMS or some third party (e.g. the delivery firm that completed the delivery) The sign of this amount changes in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales, since this is related to the payment/refund.
fields.name: PartialAmount

fields.description: List of references to other other transactions/documents and even specific line items of those transactions/documents.

Reference to another document that is usually printed on the document. The same reference might also be found in the transaction trail. Examples: - reference on a credit note to the original invoice number. - reference to the document that was replaced by the current document from a financial perspective. - reference to the original from the copy This latter is the case for invoice transforms (e.g. from ReceiptProof to Invoice or from offline to online invoice). NOTE: When making a full credit note of an Invoice, this does not replace the original document from a financial perspective, i.e. both documents are still valid and must be considered when analysing the transaction trail.
This can be used in combination with DocumentIdReference in order to secure that the reference in unambiguous. E.g. when SAMS reference the receipt for which the return transaction is valid.
fields.name: CustomerTransactionIdReference

fields.description: Reference to another document that is usually printed on the document. The same reference might be found in the transaction trail. E.g. reference on a credit note to the original invoice number.
fields.name: DocumentIdReference

fields.description: Date for when the referenced document was issued
fields.name: DocumentIssueDate

fields.description: The date/time when this Customer Transaction was recorded by the system.
fields.name: SystemImportDateTime

fields.description: The date/time when the evaluation of this Customer Transaction was completed for the first time, i.e. when the raw input imported at SystemImportDateTime was successfully transformed into an internal CT-event and made available for reports and consumer queries. The transaction could e.g. get stuck for some time in the evaluation due to some defect or similar issue.
fields.name: FirstEvaluationDateTime

fields.description: The date/time when the evaluation of this Customer Transaction was completed, i.e. the last time the raw input imported at SystemImportDateTime was successfully transformed into an internal CT-event and made available for reports and consumer queries. This date/time differs from FirstEvaluationDateTime as soon as the raw transaction is reprocessed for some reason.
fields.name: LastEvaluationDateTime

fields.description: The last validation status after evaluating the raw input data and transforming it into the internal CT-event. E.g. OK, INCOMPLETE, INVALID.
fields.name: InputValidationStatus

fields.description: The ID of the specific validation message. E.g. CTEvent.LineItemList.LineItem.Description_MaxLength
fields.name: Id

fields.description: The path to the exact instance in the payload, including list index. E.g. CTEvent.LineItemList.LineItem[1].Description
fields.name: FieldPath

fields.description: The text that describe the validation issue. E.g. ‘CTEvent.LineItemList.LineItem[1].Description’ with value (very long description …}) has a length of ({300}) allowed is max 255
fields.name: Text

fields.description: The version of the recorded customer transaction, starting with 1. This is greater than 1 in case a source system delivers an updated raw payload of an already existing customer transaction. E.g. if IPOS prints tax data on the document, but it is missing in the transaction because of a system defect, and then later resends an updated version of the transaction data.
fields.name: TransactionVersion

fields.description: The version of the format within the source system. E.g. for iSell it can be 2.0, 2.1, etc. For iPOS it can be the version of the TP.net transaction XSD.
fields.name: SourceFormatVersion

fields.description: The ID and version of the source system creating the payload. E.g. for iPOS it could be iPOS_7.8.0.13. For iSell it could be the Tax Invoice EBC version: iSellInvoice_1.1
fields.name: SourceSystemVersion

fields.description: This is the ID and version of a system that will strongly affect the content within the payload. E.g. the iSell EBC version: iSell_7.9
fields.name: SourceDependentSystemVersion

fields.description: The version of the internal CT-event XSD used to represent this transaction. E.g. 2.0.9
fields.name: InternalFormatVersion

fields.description: The ID and version of the mapping requirement document used to create this internal CT-event. E.g. iPOS_1.0.2 or iSell_1.0.0
fields.name: EvaluationMappingVersion

fields.description: The internal code version that evaluated and mapped the raw data into the internal CT-event. Typically a composition of code module name and version. E.g. iposTxEvaluation_1.3.5.4
fields.name: EvaluationCodeVersion

The cost price for the retailer. The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
CostPrice

fields.description: The regular price from the planned price list that is valid for any customer under these sales conditions (i.e. before applying price selection rules or discounts). E.g. in IPOS this can be Regular Price or Regular Eat-In Price (either restaurant or bistro). The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales. This price does not exist in case the selling system has no record of a regular price for this item. This is e.g. the case when SAMS provides a price for an item (=QualifiedPrice), while for the selling system (IPOS) this item is unknown.
Example of regular price sources: RegularSalesUnitPrice, Ukulele:RegularEatInPrice, Ukulele:RegularBistroPrice, Ukulele:RegularBistroEatInPrice
fields.name: PriceSource

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
RegularPrice

fields.description: This price is the price that the specific customer qualified for. The price is coming from different price lists, bargain prices, SAMS return (might be lowered), iSell order (might be partial payment) or manually agreed prices with the cashier. After the qualified price has been settled, other campaigns and discounts are applied on top of this. The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.

Examples of qualified price sources: - When from a price list: Ukulele:FamilyPrice, Ukulele:FamilyEatInPrice, Ukulele:CoWorkerPrice, Ukulele:CoWorkerEatInPrice, Ukulele:ContractorPrice, Ukulele:ContractorEatInPrice - Bargain items with special price (usually from barcode): IposAsIs - Manual price set by cashier during sale/return: IposManual - Original price provided by SAMS during return: SamsOriginal - Manual price set by customer relations during return: SamsManual - The price to pay for the item according to iSell (possibly partial payment): IsellToPay
fields.name: PriceSource

fields.description: This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.
fields.name: IsTaxIncluded
QualifiedPrice

fields.description: Components of financial interest that are part of the price or that needs to be added to the price. The sign of these price components does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
The context of the price component. E.g. Fee, Deposit,

fields.description: The trigger of including the price component. E.g. RecyclingFee, BottleDeposit, MattressFee, EnvironmentalFee

ExternalPriceComponentList

fields.description: This is the actual unit price, after a possible qualified price has been selected and all discounts have been applied. It might also be a calculated net price, in case the planned price was including tax but the country default setting is to not include tax in the price (e.g. in US bistro) The price must be rounded as printed on the document given to the customer. Note that this amount is not always the same as QualifiedUnitPrice - TotalUnitDiscount, since some qualified unit prices are themselves considered discounts (e.g. family prices). The sign of this price does not change in case of e.g. return transactions or cancellation of sales.
This is whether or not all indirect taxes (e.g. VAT, Sales tax) are included in the amount.

fields.description: All different discounts for this line item is in here, both single unit and line item totals. fields.description: The partial extended amount paid/refunded for this line item. This amount is specified when only parts of this line item was paid/refunded. fields.description: List of references to other other transactions/documents and even specific line items of those transactions/documents.

Reference to another document that is usually printed on the document. The same reference might also be found in the transaction trail. Examples: - reference on a credit note to the original invoice number. - reference to the document that was replaced by the current document from a financial perspective. - reference to the original from the copy This latter is the case for invoice transforms (e.g. from ReceiptProof to Invoice or from offline to online invoice). NOTE: When making a full credit note of an Invoice, this does not replace the original document from a financial perspective, i.e. both documents are still valid and must be considered when analysing the transaction trail.
This can be used in combination with DocumentIdReference in order to secure that the reference in unambiguous. E.g. when SAMS reference the receipt for which the return transaction is valid.

fields.name: TransactionHashId

fields.description: Short term: This attribute will as a start just include a flag that indicates if a message has been published due to a reprocessing job, so that a consumer can differentiate these messages from the regular real time flow. Long term: We plan to improve the reprocessing mechanism in CTM so that a consumer can trigger smaller reprocessing jobs on their own according to their specific need. Then each reprocessing job will have a unique id that will be populated in this attribute.
fields.name: ReprocessingId

fields.description: Framework added attribute. Date and time when message was ingested to BigQuery.
